title: Higher Prices and Volumes Boost Mondelez
text:
By Micah Maidenberg

Mondelez International Inc. raised prices and increased sales volumes across major markets in the third quarter as revenue surpassed Wall Street forecasts.

The maker of Oreo cookies, Wheat Thins crackers and other products on Tuesday said revenue increased to $6.36 billion in the third quarter, up from $6.29 billion a year ago. Analysts polled by FactSet predicted $6.34 billion.

Global revenue increased 4.2% from the year earlier on a comparable basis, which excludes currency fluctuations, mergers and asset sales, the company said. That was slower than the 4.6% gain Mondelez notched in the second quarter.

The company said it expanded distribution of its products in discount and club stores in the U.S. and boosted distribution of items like gum in Chinese stores. It raised prices 2.1% in the quarter and grew sales volumes by the same amount.

Mondelez reported a profit of $1.42 billion, or 98 cents a share, up from $1.19 billion, or 81 cents a share, last year.

The company's profit of 64 cents a share, following adjustments, exceeded expectations by four cents.

Mondelez also said it now expects comparable revenue to grow more than 3.5% this year, up from a previous forecast of a gain of more than 3%. Adjusted earnings could rise up to 7%, excluding currency fluctuations.

Shares fell 1.8% in after-hours trading.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires
